22.7. Plot Distribution Per Subject 462
We can see all data clustered around 0.0 across axis within a subject and across subjects.
This suggests that perhaps the data was centered (zero mean). This strong consistency across
subjects may aid in modeling, and may suggest that the diï¬€erences across subjects in the total
acceleration data may not be as helpful.
Figure 22.5: Histograms of the body acceleration data for 10 subjects.
